results.title: Starting Crochet
results.creator_credit: Maggie Clarke, Pat Marshall and MSI Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Joy for Life”.
Crochet is a soothing, rhythmic craft, practised throughout the world for thousands of years - using only a hook and a length of thread. This video and its accompanying booklet will show you how to begin, the materials you need, how to work some basic stitches; as well as some attractive items which are easy to make. Introduced by Hannah Gordon.

results.title: My Sesame Street Home Video
results.creator_credit: Jon Stone and Children's Television Workshop
results.brief_description: Featuring Jim Henson’s muppets and the Sesame St. live cast this series includes favorite segments from Sesame St. as well as brand new material. Each video tackles one theme, such as counting, or parties and is accompanied by a book of activities, puzzles and songs.

results.title: Captain and kings
results.creator_credit: Ron Lowe and Australia. Special Broadcasting Service
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “The Top end”.
The film examines why Greek immigrants settled in Darwin and their contribution to its development both socially and economically. Interviews with Greek small-businessmen and their wives are conducted about their businesses, family life and how they see themselves in both the Greek and Australian communities. Interviews with non-Greek Darwin residents are also conducted.

results.title: Chinese Territory
results.creator_credit: Ron Low, Moira Ferguson, Barbara Mariotti and New England Film Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “The Top end”.
In the late nineteenth century there were six times as many Chinese as Europeans in the Northern Territory and even now Australians of Chinese descent make up a large portion of the population. These third generation Australians are now making efforts to teach Chinese culture and language before it is lost completely. Integration of the Chinese in the Territory has been relatively painless and several Chinese Australians, including Darwin’s first Chinese Lord Mayor, talk about this and their mixed national identity.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ron Low, Moira Ferguson, Barbara Mariotti and New England Film Productions

results.title: Steve
results.creator_credit: Ron Iddon, Moira Ferguson, Barbara Mariotti, Australia. Special Broadcasting Service and New England Film Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “The Top end”.
Steve is a Hungarian chef who gave up being a chef to become a cook in a mining camp in the Northern Territory, and liked the life so much that he became a prospector for gold. Now retired, he lives with his wife Essie on the Pine Creek goldfield, two hours south of Darwin. The program explores the history of the goldfield and the town of Spring Hill which, with the advent of new technology, is now undergoing a revival.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ron Iddon, Moira Ferguson, Barbara Mariotti, Australia. Special Broadcasting Service and New England Film Productions

results.title: George
results.creator_credit: Ron Iddon, Barbara Mariotti, Moira Ferguson, SBS-TV and New England Film Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “The Top end”.
Czech born George Chaloupka became fascinated by Aboriginal Art soon after his arrival in Australia in the 1950s. Since 1958 he has lived and worked in the far north of the continent cataloguing and researching Aboriginal Rock Art, some of which goes back twenty thousand years. A trained anthropologist, Chaloupka sees the art of indigenous Australians as an important historic record for both indigenous and white Australians as well as being examples of great aesthetic beauty.

results.title: Elisabeth
results.creator_credit: Ron Iddon and New England Film Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “The Top end”.
Elisabeth Stenhouse, trained as a sausage maker, emigrated to Australia from Berlin in 1956 at the age of 24. In the 60’s, she met and married stockman, Des Stenhouse, and now lives on a large Northern Territory cattle station, Helen Springs, which her husband manages and where she works as the supervisor of domestic staff. This half hour profile of the Stenhouse family shows how Elisabeth and Des work as a team to produce a sense of community in this isolated part of Australia, a place Elisabeth now definitely sees as her home.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ron Iddon and New England Film Productions

results.title: Guido
results.creator_credit: Ron Iddon, Moira Ferguson and Australia. Special Broadcasting Service
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “The Top end”.
Engineer Guido Zuccoli was born in Northern Italy in 1940 and migrated to Australia in 1961. The owner of a large and successful Darwin-based construction company, Guido claims “my work is my first hobby”. But Guido has another hobby about which he is passionate - aircraft. Guido first took up flying to commute easily between far-flung engineering projects in the Territory, but he began to practice daring aerobatics and has won the Australian championship many times. Plagued in his mid-forties by the headaches which signal the end of a career in competititve aerobatics, he purchased and restored three 1947 Hawker Sea Fury fighter planes to continue the “pure joy” he finds in his aircraft.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ron Iddon, Moira Ferguson and Australia. Special Broadcasting Service
